intro: Ophiorrhiza mungos, commonly known as the small-leaf everlet, is a tropical shrub belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually less than 2 cm in length. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Ophiorrhiza mungos is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
